instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..

threads.title: did firmware flash just disable Touch ID??
threads.message:
2017, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBP, non T2, had a FindMy lock on it, and a firmware lock if I tried to boot into recovery

I cleared the firmware lock by flashing a clean bios bin, and then immediately did a pram reset and booted from an external drive and installed Catalina. all good except Touch ID doesn't work, but when I say doesn't work, it prompts me to set it up, but when I touch my finger on it there's no response. 

anyone ever seen firmware flashing affect Touch ID? there's no way to know unfortunately if Touch ID worked before, but by all indications this logic board and presumably power button are original to this machine

threads.title: did firmware flash just disable Touch ID??
threads.message:
Probably board was already swapped.
Touch ID and MLB don't match...
